questions: Describe your experience of being diagnosed or told your disease had progressed.
responses: I felt sad and depressed with the whole situation. I just didn't know what to do.

questions: Describe your experience of being diagnosed or told your disease had progressed.
responses: Once my PSA level was detected to be abnormally high, and after a positive biopsy, and a subsequent prostatectomy, the PSA began steadily rising, again. I went through some 80 radiation treatments, which lowered the PSA levels a bit, but not for long. Scans could not - and have not - been able to detect anything. My urologist wanted to put me on testosterone blockers, but after consulting with my oncologist, I decided that I did not want to take that kind of drug.

questions: Describe your experience of being diagnosed or told your disease had progressed.
responses: The doctors wanted to use surgery, But I thought my chances were equal with radiation treatment
